content.question: Which of the following is true of an economyâ€™s production possibilities curve?

choices.label: It shows the combinations of any two resources that can be used to produce an efficient level of output.
It shows the alternative combinations of goods that can be produced by fully employing scarce resources.
It must be a straight line when all resources are fully employed.
It is bowed in (convex to the origin) because of changing levels of technology.
It is bowed out (concave to the origin) when marginal opportunity costs are constant.

content.answer: It shows the alternative combinations of goods that can be produced by fully employing scarce resources.
